column4: can i ask, has anyone been able to get skype to work on breezy?
how? ive tried 3 or 4 differnt guides, none of them seem to work
lemme try to remember what I did to install it..
if I recall you'll get an error if trying to install the debian package because of a broken dependency, right?
i think theres a lib version breezy uses thats newer than the one skype does
if I'm not way off I think I actually opened the .deb and made a new one with the correct dependency..
hmmn i think thats a bit complicated for me, im a bit of a no0b :S
I'll remember exactly what I did...just give me a few minutes =)
if you copy the contents of that script to a file, place it in the folder where you have downloaded the .deb and run it using the .deb as a parameter you should be all set :)
hm...weird...I can't seem to find libqt3c102-mt in my repositories..
so that error wasn't with seveas' packages?
i know, it looks as if its been removed
like i said im new to this, im having trouble adding the repository
what you want to do is just add one of the mirrors to /etc/apt/sources.list  - You can use whatever editor you want as long as you're root :)
i got it working, seems to be through a combination of your post and Seveas's repos, not quite sure how, but it seems ok \o/
